metadata.title: CVE-2024-43890 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:tracing: Fix overflow in get_free_elt()"tracing_map->next_elt" in get_free_elt() is at risk of overflowing.Once it overflows, new elements can still be inserted into the tracing_mapeven though the maximum number of elements (`max_elts`) has been reached.Continuing to insert elements after the overflow could result in thetracing_map containing "tracing_map->max_size" elements, leaving no emptyentries.If any attempt is made to insert an element into a full tracing_map using`__tracing_map_insert()`, it will cause an infinite loop with preemptiondisabled, leading to a CPU hang problem.Fix this by preventing any further increments to "tracing_map->next_elt"once it reaches "tracing_map->max_elt".

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43890` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
